Date:16-12-2022  
EXPERIMENT-1  
                
Aim:  
(a) To calibrate an electromagnet.  
(b) To study the dependence of Hall voltage on magnetic 
field and current through the sample.  
Theory:  
If a current carrying conductor placed in a perpendicular 
magnetic field, a potential difference will generate in the 
conductor which is perpendicular to both magnetic field 
and current. This phenomenon is call Hall Effect. In solid 
state physics, Hall effect is an important tool to 
characterize the materials especially semiconductors. It  
Fig. 1: Schematic representation of Hall Effect in a conductor.  
3 
directly determines both the sign and density of charge 
carriers in a given sample.  
Fig. 1: Schematic representation of Hall Effect in a conductor.

Results & Discussion:  
1. The Hall coefficient of Gold is 0.7 m3/C which is 
exactly equal to standard value.   
2. The of carrier concentration is approximately equal to 
8.92857 X 1018m-3. There is some error because the 
value of electronic charge is taken 1.60217662 X 10-
19 by me and the simulator must have taken a far less 
precise value.   
9 
3. In this experiment we learned about the Hall effect, its 
properties and calibration of electromagnet.
